Required Courses
FSC 101 Introductory Forensic Science 3
CHE 110 General Chemistry I 3
& CHE 110L and General Chemistry I Laboratory 1
CJ 101 Introduction to the Criminal Justice System 3
CJ 215 Criminal Investigation 3

Elective Courses
Select two of the following: 6
Any 200-level or above BIO, CHE or FSC course
CJ 211 Criminal Law
CJ 212 Criminal Procedure
CJ 340 Rules of Evidence
Total Credits 19

Requirements:
The minor in game design and development requires the completion of 18 credits as follows.

Required Courses (9 credits)
GDD 110	Introduction to Game Design	3
GDD 120	Digital Media Production	3
GDD 210	Game Studies	3

Electives (9 credits)
Select 9 credits from the following courses:
GDD 220	Game Prototyping	3
GDD 230	Level Design	3
GDD 240	Introduction to Game Art and Engines	3
GDD 250	Writing for Interactive Media	3
GDD 310	Game Production	3
GDD 320	User Interface and User Experience for Games	3
GDD 330	Introduction to 3D Modeling and Animation for Games	3
GDD 331	Character Art and Animation for Games	3
GDD 332	Game Environments	3
GDD 340	Game Audio	3
GDD 350	History of Games	3
GDD 390	Special Topics in Game Design and Development	3
GDD 499	Independent Study	1-3
CSC 110	Introduction to Computing and Programming	3
FVP 220	Introduction to Animation	3
JOUR 285	Interactive Digital Design	3
Program name: Minor in Game Design and Development

Requirements: The student must submit a proposal that includes a title for the minor, a statement of purpose for the minor, a proposed list of at least five courses that will fulfill the minor, and a completion plan. The individualized minor proposal must be endorsed by a full-time faculty member who has agreed to serve as the minor adviser and approved by the appropriate dean or designee. Students must have a cumulative GPA of at least 2.500 to declare an individualized minor. Proposals must be submitted before the student has completed 90 credits.

A minimum of 18 credits is required for the minor. Students must complete the following:
- Three 100- or 200-level political science courses
- Three 300- or 400-level political science courses

- A maximum of 6 credits may be transferred into the minor.

To apply to the bachelor’s in professional studies, you will need to: Submit an application. We require a $65 nonrefundable application fee, but will waive it if you attend one of our information sessions. Submit all official college/university transcripts. Quinnipiac University requires transcripts from all colleges/universities attended to be sent directly from each institution to the Office of Admissions. We recommend that you have a minimum cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 2.5. Submit a resume. Submit a personal statement. The personal statement is an essay that helps our faculty learn more about you as a person and as a student. Describe your background and the strengths you will bring to the program and to your future career.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Professional Studies

Requirements: To be considered for admission to the online bachelor's degree in professional studies, applicants are required to submit the following: Online application; Official transcripts from all previously attended institutions; An essay or personal statement describing your personal and professional goals and how the online Bachelor of Science in Professional Studies will help you achieve them; A current resume; A cumulative GPA of 2.5 or higher from previous college-level coursework.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Professional Studies
